raw_text: The patient is complaining from bilateral knee pain since five years. Two years ago, the pain increased. Plane X-ray was done showing advanced osteoarthritis grade 4. Non-steroidal anti-inflammatory was given for around one month with muscle relaxants showing mild improvement. She is now doing physiotherapy exercises to see again after two weeks.
refined_text: The patient has been experiencing bilateral knee pain for five years. The pain worsened two years ago. A plain X-ray revealed advanced osteoarthritis grade 4. Non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs were administered for approximately one month, along with muscle relaxants, resulting in mild improvement. She is currently undergoing physiotherapy exercises and will be reassessed after two weeks.

Non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs were administered for approximately one month, along with muscle relaxants, resulting in mild improvement. She is currently undergoing physiotherapy exercises and will be reassessed after two weeks.

json_data.history_of_illness: The patient has been experiencing bilateral knee pain for five years. The pain worsened two years ago.
json_data.imaging_results: plain X-ray revealed advanced osteoarthritis grade 4
json_data.plan: physiotherapy exercises, reassessment after two weeks

reasoning: The patient presents with bilateral knee pain, a chief complaint that has been ongoing for five years and worsened over the past two years. The diagnosis of advanced osteoarthritis grade 4 is supported by the plain X-ray findings, corresponding to ICD-10 code M17.0 for bilateral primary osteoarthritis. The patient was initially treated with non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs and muscle relaxants, which resulted in mild improvement. The current plan involves physiotherapy exercises, with a follow-up reassessment scheduled for two weeks later to evaluate the effectiveness of the treatment and potentially adjust the management plan.
